website_summaries.verdict: Although it’s one of the company’s pricier tablets, the CT100 is worth every penny. It runs Google’s ultra-secure Chrome OS, it’s got a military-grade case to protect it from damage, and the 2048 by 1536 display is stunning.
pros: The durable exterior and rubber bumpers keep this tablet protected from just about anything
It’s fast enough to use for work, but portable enough for play
It comes with a Wacom stylus
cons: Some power users say it’s not fast enough for them
Chrome OS can be a little more cumbersome to use on a tablet than it is on a laptop

customer_reviews.title: Chrome OS is not ready for tablets yet...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the hardware is good, but the OS is not yet ready for tablets. It may take more time to replace android tablets. By the way, the so-called Amazon Warehouse CLEANING is not really as good as the one in the ad video.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great idea with a little lag.
customer_reviews.text: Chrome tablet is a great idea and I hope it gets better. The OS isn't ready for tablet form yet as others have mentioned. The processor on this tablet or ram just isn't enough to handle the tasks without lag. Other than that the actual device is great. Perfect size for couch surfing.
customer_reviews.author: C Harper

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a "leave on the coffee table", browse, read the news, etc. tool. I've had this device for a little over three months and sadly I made a poor buying choice. It will not stay connected to WiFi, though none of our other devices have this problem. I have to completely shut it off and turn it on again to get it to connect. Gets hung up occasionally and will not finish loading an app. With occasional use (less than 2 hours a day) the battery needs rechargng every two to three days. Not at all the quality I expected from Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Touch is off
customer_reviews.text: Touch sensitivity is just plain off. Always gets random clicks or slow taps. Bought it to demo apps at work , glad I bought one instead of multiple. Don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Barbosa

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money...and it runs CHROME!
customer_reviews.text: The only cons that I have for this tablet is that I wish it had a little more storage than 32gb, maybe 64gb. You can still throw a micro sd card in it to expand the storage to take care of that and a little more memory than 4gb...say 6 or 8gb would have been nice. Still, with the 4gb of memory it has it will run any app you install on it and it is really fast. Otherwise this tablet is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan E. Young

customer_reviews.title: This is a good tablet for basic email, surfing, and e-reading.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet for e-reading and email reading while traveling. Works well for that. I was also able to add android and Linux apps with no issues. Linux apps can be a little sluggish loading but once running are just fine. I also use an external folding keyboard and mouse, this works well also.
customer_reviews.author: Ping Jockey

customer_reviews.title: Not rugged at all!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet claims to be rugged and great for kids. My 10 yr old dropped it from the couch not even 3 ft onto carpet and it hasnt turned on since. 400.00 in the trash! And there are no videos on how to fix it. And now that I am looking for how to fix it im reading how awful this tablet really is. Dont waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chromebook Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Chromebook Tablet. Has built- in stylus. Lightweight. Only downside is the no-so-travel-friendly power supply which is too large and heavy. Wish there was a smaller alternative for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Google still has some work to do before Chrome OS on a tablet is as polished as Android. They have made good movement in recent months though. Guaranteed updates and a longer support cycle than Android gets from most hardware companies make it worthwhile though.
customer_reviews.author: J Condon

customer_reviews.title: Great, but keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great Tablet, just was wanting a good keyboard for it. I bought the c314 to replace. The CT 100 seemed snappier and definitely had a better screen. The C314 has a better battery, but at the cost of screen and significant weight difference
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Crashes and freezes frequently. works great when it actually works
customer_reviews.text: Crashes and freezes frequently. Very annoying when you only have one tab open in Chrome and you have to reset.
customer_reviews.author: Ian J Cable

customer_reviews.title: Screen touch sensitivity could be be better
customer_reviews.text: Screen touch sensitivity could be be better. Does not allway detect touch from either my or wife's fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Pallen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect a “computer”.
customer_reviews.text: Was not capable of the work I needed to accomplish. Much more of a giant smart phone than a “chrome book”.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: the good screen but many virtual keyboard lag
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I Can't keep landscape screen when external Bluetooth keyboard is on. It change in ''portrait'' mode
customer_reviews.author: debaia

customer_reviews.title: An otherwise great device has some defects.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is defective. Bound to happen with a refurbished product. Otherwise a fantastic device, but I will reconsider buying another refurbished product from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. No glitches, or freezes. Battery life is great!
customer_reviews.author: Shawnté Monique

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love Chrome devices. I have now been with Google for 5 years and not once have I had a virus or reinstall software, which I had to do with Microsoft weekly. This tablet works much better than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like it. But there is one negative issue: the screen goes black suddenly, then I reset and move on.??
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook for the Win!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this device. I will be watching for a version with detachable keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kenne Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen 😔
customer_reviews.text: How can the designers make a touch interface like this and be ok with it? Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Cory

customer_reviews.title: A well-built device running Chrome OS
customer_reviews.text: At it's size (9.7 inch 3:2 aspect ratio), this is the best Chrome OS tablet there is in the market right now (not counting convertibles and detachables). With a good screen, scratch resistant body, stowable stylus and Chrome OS, this tablet is worth buying. I just wished there is a larger internal storage option. But you can basically just buy a micro SD card to increase your storage.
customer_reviews.author: iamakii

customer_reviews.title: Mini Chrome!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is a very solid choice for those that dont want to spent big bux on a new tablet. It's a tablet using parts of the Chromebook system, by Google. That means it is , by design, very secure without buying extra security and also very stable. You will need a Google sign in , but other than that, it's very easy to use. For games, you can get a inexpensive subscription and game all you like. This Asus Chromebook Tablet CT100 is a very solid option!
customer_reviews.author: Wulfstan

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good device, not the greatest but not the worst. I found my self getting frustrated when typing and I had to use the stylus a lot. It has great life battery and it works great for typing school papers. I have a keyboard to attach to this so that helps for school papers my daughters type. It’s durable my son has dropped it a lot of times and also stepped on it a few times. This thing can stand anything so far. Overall it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: marmar

customer_reviews.title: Glitches a lot
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to have a chrome book but for some reason the screen goes dark. It is still on but the screen turns black. I can still see the messenger pop ups but I have to turn off and restart the chrome book every time I want to use it!!! It only stays lit for a short amount of time. This was a thumbs down for me unless I figure out what's wrong with it and it gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Tablet
customer_reviews.text: It is a good tablet for daily use. You can easily take notes, draw, and watch videos on it, with it acting as a more mobile chromebook than the traditional. The lack of a keyboard is not a big concert as the touchscreen is very reliable. The screen is very high quality, with great brighness.
customer_reviews.author: Hubba Bubba

feature_bullets: Asus Chromebook tablet Ct100 is built to endure intensive use with military-grade protection. All four exterior edges and corners are protected by a tough rubber bumper, which reduces the impact of physical shocks to ensure critical components are always safe and sound.
Stunning 9.7’’ qxga (2048 x 1536) Touchscreen designed to be used with the included stylus and in various lighting conditions both indoor and outdoor.
Has a rubber safety grip to help drops from happening, and a durable 3d-textured finish to help with scratches and fingerprints. This is a must feature for Chromebook tablets to help prevent damage.
Powered by the powered by OP1, Hexa-Core (Dual arm Cortex-A72, Quad Cortex-A53) for fast and snappy performance. Perfect for running lots of tabs and apps.
4GB DDR3 RAM; 32GB eMMC storage, USB Type-C (Gen 1), and Micro SD card slot. (Usb transfer speed may vary. Learn more at Asus website)
